Discussion of science, intellect, and the impossible object is coherent. This is excellent quality OCR for complex philosophical content.

pages.evidence: Dense theoretical passage on the parergon's status as both inside and outside, its quasi-detachability. German terms well-rendered: 'angehiingt' (angehängt = appended), 'nebengeschafte' (Nebengeschäfte = secondary business). Philosophical argument on supplement's paradoxical relation to work clearly articulated.
pages.footnote_artifacts: Umlaut renderings: 'angehiingt' (angehängt), 'stossen' (stoßen) use standard ASCII approximations. 'schrift' = writing. Complex argument on parergon's structural necessity to cover internal lack well-preserved. Footnote 10 on 'quadrillee' correctly integrated.
pages.assessment: Good quality. Sophisticated argument on the parergon's paradoxical status (neither inside nor outside, necessary supplement to internal lack) clearly presented despite umlaut approximations.

pages.evidence: Discussion of parergon in Religion within Limits of Reason Alone. German philosophical terms accurate: 'Erganzung' (Ergänzung = supplementation), 'Besitz' (possession), 'Nebengeschafte' (secondary business). French-German philosophical dialogue on grace, mystery, miracles as necessary supplements to reason well-articulated.
pages.footnote_artifacts: 'supplemen- tary' = word boundary artifact (supplementary), 'erganzen' = ergänzen (supplement). 'kommen' correct German. Text establishes parergon as necessary but dangerous supplement, each with corresponding risk (fanaticism, superstition, illuminism, thaumaturgy). Argument coherent.
pages.assessment: Good quality. Philosophical argument on the four classes of parergonal danger in Religion clearly structured. German-French scholarly apparatus well-preserved.

pages.evidence: Analysis of parergon (clothing on statues) as neither internal nor external to the represented body. German/French terms well-captured: 'Gewander an Statuen' (clothes on statues), 'innerlich', 'Bestandstück', 'Zuthat' (addition). Complex question of representational integrity and the parergon's role in maintaining/concealing lack clearly posed.
pages.footnote_artifacts: 'trans' = fragment boundary. 'tiful' = beautiful. 'heisst' (heißt = means) correct. 'gegenstandes' (Gegenstandes = of object) correct. Philosophical problem of where parergon begins/ends well-articulated. Question of Cranach's Lucretia as example clearly introduced.
pages.assessment: Good quality. Sophisticated question on how parergon (garment) supplements representational lack in art well-posed. Moves toward analysis of parergon's paradoxical status.

pages.evidence: Discussion of columns as parergon examples, moving toward general theory of parergon's structural necessity. German terms accurate: 'Säulengiinge um Prachtgebäude' (colonnades around sumptuous buildings), 'Gebäude' (building). Philosophical argument on internal lack and parergon's necessary detachment well-developed.
pages.footnote_artifacts: Umlaut rendering: 'siiulengiinge' (Säulengänge), 'gebiiude' (Gebäude). 'struc-turally' = structural. 'cho' = chosen. Unknown_words are legitimate philosophical terms ('parerga', 'exteriority', 'ergon', 'parergon'). Argument on why columns count as parergon (difficult to detach, hide internal lack) clearly reasoned.
pages.assessment: Excellent quality. Theoretical architecture of the parergon (as marker of internal structural lack) becomes clear. Philosophical rigor in distinguishing parergon from mere environmental context well-maintained.

pages.evidence: Analysis of frame as parergon, integrating it with garment and column examples. German/English terms accurate: 'Einfassungen der Gemälde' (frames of paintings), 'energeia' (Greek = activity/presence). Philosophical argument on frame's double edge (boundary between work and milieu, with thickness) clearly articulated.
pages.footnote_artifacts: 'gemiilde' = Gemälde (paintings), 'einfassungen' = Einfassungen, 'dif' = difficulty fragment, 'bord' = border. 'amples' = examples. Text develops theory that frame (like garment, column) marks the work's internal lack while remaining exterior. Argument structure clear.
pages.assessment: Good quality. Integrates three parergon examples (garment, column, frame) into unified theory. Philosophical argument on parergon's paradoxical status (necessary supplement that must remain detachable) well-developed.

pages.evidence: Analysis of parergon's double ground (merging into work when viewed against milieu, merging into milieu when viewed against work). Complex philosophical exposition well-rendered: 'hermeneuticist', 'semioticist', 'phenomenologicalist', 'formalist' - all English philosophical schools clearly named.
pages.footnote_artifacts: 'malist' = formalist, 'sibylj' = Sibyl (chapel figure), 'semioticist' correct, 'detache' = detached, 'prac' = practice, 'phenomenologicalist' correct, 'hermeneuticist' correct, 'ergonal' correct. Text on Sistine Chapel frescos (Jonah, Persian Sibyl, Zachariah, Jeremiah, Libyan Sibyl) complex but legible.
pages.assessment: Good quality. Sophisticated meta-theoretical argument positioning parergon against hermeneutic, semiotic, phenomenological, and formalist traditions. Complex Sistine Chapel analysis presented.

pages.evidence: Analysis of parergon's division into two types: normal parergon (beautiful form, enhances aesthetic judgment) vs. degraded parergon/adornment (Schmuck - seduction by sensory charm without form). German philosophical vocabulary accurate: 'Reiz' (charm), 'Schmuck' (finery), 'Wohlgefallen des Geschmacks' (pleasure of taste).
pages.footnote_artifacts: 'rahmen' (Rahmen = frame) correct, 'reiz' (Reiz) correct, 'tiful' = beautiful, 'goldene' (goldene = golden) correct, 'termining' = determining, 'abbruch' (Abbruch = detriment) correct, 'nonform' correct. Text clarifies that gilded frame (sensory attraction) is bad while formal frame design is good. Distinction central to aesthetic theory clearly stated.
pages.assessment: Good quality. Philosophical distinction between form (good) and sensory matter/color (bad) in aesthetic judgment clearly articulated. Critique of pure form tradition (Kant, Hegel, Heidegger) well-positioned.

pages.evidence: Hyphenation artifacts and fragments: 'elimina-tion', 'parliamen-tary', 'viz' (abbreviation), proper name fragments. Main text is readable but some technical terms are split. Semantic meaning largely preserved.

Multiple proper name corruptions: 'naroda', 'del Naroda', 'messrs' (formatting), 'cisms', 'candour', 'vanderveldes', 'delo', 'rusanov'. German/Russian names severely corrupted. Additionally: 'labour' vs 'labor' (British spelling, but not OCR error). Proper noun corruption damages semantic accuracy.
pages.review_note: Reclassified from BAD: foreign language terms incorrectly flagged

pages.evidence: Minor fragments and hyphenation: 'anar-chist', 'ordi-nary', 'practi-cal'. Proper nouns present (plekhanov, tsereteli) but text overall clean and readable. No severe semantic corruption.

Hyphenation and word fragmentation: 'occupations', 'associations', 'billetings', 'proudhonist'. Proper compound terms split across lines. Semantic meaning recoverable but fragmentation affects clarity.
Term fragments and hyphenation: 'anarchists', 'nationalists', 'blanquists', 'interna-tional'. These are properly-formed terms but split. No severe semantic corruption, meaning is clear from context.
Hyphenation artifacts: 'authoritari-anists', 'pudiated' (repudiated), 'machin-ery', 'tion' fragments. Word boundaries mostly intact. Semantic meaning preserved despite formatting issues.
Minor fragments: 'tion', 'etarian', 'bracke' (likely 'Bracke'), 'prol-etarian'. Text is generally clean with only hyphenation artifacts. No significant semantic corruption.

Word fragments: 'valu-able', 'tively' (relative), 'atten-tively', 'tions'. Hyphenation artifacts and German compound terms. Meaning is recoverable. Proper nouns (Kautsky, Neue Zeit) handled reasonably well.
Minor fragments and abbreviations: 'eradicat-ing', 'switzerlandization', 'pletely'. Text is clean overall. Hyphenation artifacts do not significantly impair semantic understanding.

German terms and proper names with artifacts: 'bezirksstatthalter', 'gemeinde', 'regierungsrate', 'kerenski'. Fragment handling of complex administrative terms. Meaning recoverable but technical accuracy affected.
Minor abbreviations and fragments: 'niques' (techniques), 'tech', 'cracy', 'etc'. Text flows well and semantic meaning is clear. No critical OCR errors affecting embeddings.
Minimal errors. Only minor fragments: 'labour' (British spelling), 'mis-taken'. Text is very clean. Error rate of 0.6% is excellent. No semantic corruption.
Minor hyphenation artifacts: 'ity', 'concep-tion', 'nism' (communism). Text is clean and readable. Semantic meaning well-preserved. Error rate of 2.0% is acceptable.

clean - no semantic corruption. 'Kautsky' and similar proper names appear consistently and correctly throughout. Unknown words in sample (revo, tion, kaut, ques) are legitimate word fragments from hyphenation (revo-lutionary, func-tion, Kaut-sky, ques-tion) used to break lines, standard for printed books. No OCR errors affecting meaning.

clean - no semantic corruption. Unknown words sample (sprengung, tunists, impres, inconceiv, opportun, conces, prolet, analysing) are all legitimate word fragments from hyphenation typical of printed text formatting. German word 'Sprengung' is correctly rendered. No errors affecting semantic meaning or embeddings.

clean - no semantic corruption. Hyphenation fragments noted (bureaucra, introduc, ordi, tion) are standard line breaks. The text is coherent and reads logically. All proper names (Kautsky, Pannekoek, Webbs) are correctly rendered. No OCR errors affecting meaning.

clean - text is coherent and semantically sound. Unknown words (democratism, cated, prac, analysing, messrs, critico, practi, mensheviks) are legitimate - either hyphenation fragments or correctly OCR'd words (e.g., 'critico-analytical' split across hyphenation). Passage about Commune and bureaucrats reads clearly. No semantic corruption.

clean - proper names correctly rendered (Scheidemann, Plekhanov, Vandervelde, Legien, Tsereteli, Chernov). German loanwords (entgegenkommende, kerschiebung) are correctly OCR'd. Text is semantically coherent discussing mass strikes and state power. Unknown words are likely proper nouns in original languages. No damaging OCR errors.

clean - text is semantically coherent. Proper names correctly rendered (Kautsky, Legien, David, Kolb, Jauresists, Vandervelde, Turati, Treves, Fabians, Independents). Unknown words (lic, kolb, labour, dicts, repub) are legitimate fragments or correctly spelled terms. No OCR errors affecting meaning or embeddings.

Minor OCR errors present. 'Avksentev' correctly rendered. Issues: 'discrimi' (appears to be hyphenated 'discrimi-nated' or OCR fragment of 'discriminated'). Page contains glossary entries with proper names and dates that are mostly correct. Error rate of 5.3% suggests primarily formatting artifacts rather than semantic corruption. Text remains usable.

Moderate OCR errors noted in unknown words sample. 'diihring' vs 'duhring' (legitimate variant or OCR error - both appear to reference Dühring), 'domi' is fragment of 'dominant', 'naroda' correctly rendered. Roman numerals (xxiv, xxix, xvi, xxviii) are correctly OCR'd. Error rate of 12.5% is concerning but glossary entries remain mostly intelligible. Some uncertainty about whether errors propagate to semantic meaning.

clean - glossary page with proper names and biographical information correctly rendered. Hegel, Herostratos, Hyndman, Jaures, Kautsky entries are clear and semantically sound. Unknown words (neue, zeit, hyndman, herostratos, keir, ticipation, flicts) - 'neue zeit' is correctly rendered German for journal name, fragments are from hyphenation. No semantic corruption affecting RAG embeddings.

Notable OCR errors present. Error rate of 12.1% detected. 'ernment' (government fragment), 'etician' (theoretician fragment), 'mentarian' (parliamentarian fragment), 'partici' (participation fragment), 'jus' (justice fragment). Most are hyphenation artifacts but the 'xxx', 'xxiv' roman numerals suggest scanning/OCR processing issues. Text remains intelligible but errors are more than formatting.

Significant OCR issues noted. Error rate of 14.5%. 'waldeck', 'mikhailovski', 'inher' (inherit/inherited fragment), 'viks' (sheviks fragment from 'Bolsheviks'), 'sheviks' (Mensheviks fragment). Roman numerals appear (xxx, xxix, xxiv). Multiple proper names are partially corrupted (Mikhailovski split awkwardly). Text remains somewhat readable but embedding quality would be affected.

Glossary page, largely clean. Proper names: Palchinski, Produgol, Pannekoek, Paris commune all correctly rendered. Unknown words (defence, labour, produgol, introduc, tion, ment) are either legitimate British spellings ('defence', 'labour') or hyphenation fragments. Error rate of 7.2% appears to be primarily formatting-related. Semantic meaning preserved.

Glossary page, semantically sound. Proper names correctly rendered: Potresov, Pravda, Proudhon, Radek, Renaudel, Rubanovich, Rusanov. Unknown words (defence, labour, sheviks, programme, mensheviks, shevik) are legitimate - either British spellings or fragments from hyphenated words. Error rate of 8.4% is acceptable for formatting. No semantic corruption.

Glossary page, well-rendered. Proper names correct: Scheidemann, Sembat, Shylock, Skobelev. Historical periods and organization names clearly stated. Unknown words (stische, labour, cessor, xxiii, monatshefte) are hyphenation fragments or correctly spelled terms. Error rate of 6.0% acceptable for glossary formatting. No errors affecting semantic meaning.

Glossary page with notable OCR issues. Error rate of 10.2%. Proper names mostly correct (Stirner, Stauning, Turati, Tsereteli, Vandervelde) but 'interna' (international fragment), 'rada' (Central Rada - correctly rendered but listed as unknown), 'monatshefte' correctly rendered. Unknown words suggest some fragmentation but main entries remain intelligible. Marginal for RAG quality.

Severe OCR degradation. Error rate of 25.0% - highest in batch. Unknown words: 'weydemeyer' (correctly rendered but flagged), 'ple' (multiple fragment - suspicious), 'zenzinov' listed as unknown (correctly spelled), 'tionaries' (revolutionaries fragment), 'naroda' (correctly rendered), 'khanov' (suspicious corruption - possibly 'Plekhanov'), 'revolu' (revolution fragment). Multiple proper names appear corrupted or fragmented. Embeddings would be severely damaged by this level of corruption. Glossary entries partially unreadable.
